NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ChargeItemDefinition 0..*ChargeItemDefinitionDefinition of properties and rules about how the price and the applicability of a ChargeItem can be determined
url 1..1uriCanonical identifier for this charge item definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
identifier 0..*IdentifierAdditional identifier for the charge item definition
version 0..1stringBusiness version of the charge item definition
title 0..1stringName for this charge item definition (human friendly)
derivedFromUri 0..*uriUnderlying externally-defined charge item definition
partOf 0..*canonical(ChargeItemDefinition)A larger definition of which this particular definition is a component or step
replaces 0..*canonical(ChargeItemDefinition)Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request
status 1..1codedraft | active | retired | unknown
experimental 0..1booleanFor testing purposes, not real usage
date 0..1dateTimeDate last changed
publisher 0..1stringName of the publisher (organization or individual)
contact 0..*ContactDetailContact details for the publisher
description 0..1markdownNatural language description of the charge item definition
useContext 0..*UsageContextThe context that the content is intended to support
jurisdiction 0..*CodeableConceptIntended jurisdiction for charge item definition (if applicable)
copyright 0..1markdownUse and/or publishing restrictions
approvalDate 0..1dateWhen the charge item definition was approved by publisher
lastReviewDate 0..1dateWhen the charge item definition was last reviewed
effectivePeriod 0..1PeriodWhen the charge item definition is expected to be used
code 0..1CodeableConceptBilling codes or product types this definition applies to
instance 0..*Reference(Medication | Substance | Device)Instances this definition applies to
applicability
description 0..1stringNatural language description of the condition
language 0..1stringLanguage of the expression
expression 0..1stringBoolean-valued expression
propertyGroup
applicability 0..*Conditions under which the priceComponent is applicable
priceComponent
type 1..1codebase | surcharge | deduction | discount | tax | informational
code 0..1CodeableConceptCode identifying the specific component
factor 0..1decimalFactor used for calculating this component
amount 0..1MoneyMonetary amount associated with this component

Documentation for this format

name: SatuSehatChargeItemDefinition
title: Satu Sehat Charge Item Definition
description: Defines the ID Core constraints on the ChargeItemDefinition resource for billing item definitions.

element.short: Definition of properties and rules about how the price and the applicability of a ChargeItem can be determined
element.definition: The ChargeItemDefinition resource provides the properties that apply to the (billing) codes necessary to calculate costs and prices. The properties may differ largely depending on type and realm, therefore this resource gives only a rough structure and requires profiling for each type of billing code system.

constraint.human: Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Canonical identifier for this charge item definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: Berisi satu data URI absolut yang digunakan untuk mengidentifikasi definisi item tagihan, yang datanya direpresentasikan dengan tipe data uri.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.

The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#versions). 

In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.
element.requirements: Allows the charge item definition to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Additional identifier for the charge item definition
element.definition: Berisi data pengenal formal yang digunakan untuk mengidentifikasi definisi item tagihan yang direpresentasikan dengan tipe data Identifier.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this charge item definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.
element.requirements: Allows externally provided and/or usable business identifiers to be easily associated with the module.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Business version of the charge item definition
element.definition: Berisi data versi dari definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data string.
element.comment: There may be different charge item definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the charge item definition with the format [url]|[version].

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Name for this charge item definition (human friendly)
element.definition: Berisi data judul singkat, deskriptif, yang ramah pengguna untuk definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data string.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Underlying externally-defined charge item definition
element.definition: Berisi data URL yang mendasari definisi item tagihan yang ditentukan secara eksternal dengan tipe data uri.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A larger definition of which this particular definition is a component or step
element.definition: Berisi definisi yang lebih besar di mana definisi tertentu merupakan komponen atau langkah dengan tipe data canonical(ChargeItemDefinition).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request
element.definition: Berisi data versi-versi baru dari protokol atau pedoman yang didefinisikan, memungkinkan identifikasi versi mana yang digantikan oleh instansi baru dengan tipe data canonical(ChargeItemDefinition).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: Berisi data status dari definisi item tagihan yang umumnya akan berupa status draft, active, retired, dan unknown dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi PublicationStatus.
element.comment: Allows filtering of charge item definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired {{title}} without due consideration

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: Berisi data untuk menunjukkan bahwa definisi item tagihan ditulis untuk tujuan pengujian (atau pendidikan/evaluasi/pemasaran) dan tidak dimaksudkan untuk digunakan secara nyata dengan tipe data boolean.
element.comment: Allows filtering of charge item definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.
element.requirements: Enables experimental content to be developed following the same lifecycle that would be used for a production-level charge item definition.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: Berisi data tanggal (dan opsional waktu) ketika definisi item tagihan tersebut diterbitkan dengan tipe data dateTime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the charge item definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: Berisi data nama organisasi atau individu yang menerbitkan definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data string.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the charge item definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the charge item definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the charge item definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the charge item definition.  May also allow for contact.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Berisi detail kontak untuk membantu pengguna menemukan dan berkomunikasi dengan penerbit dengan tipe data ContactDetail.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Natural language description of the charge item definition
element.definition: Berisi deskripsi teks bebas bahasa alami dari definisi item tagihan dari sudut pandang konsumen dengan tipe data markdown.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the charge item definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the charge item definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the charge item definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the charge item definition was created).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: Berisi data konteks yang dikembangkan dengan fokus dan tujuan untuk mendukung konteks yang terdaftar dengan tipe data UsageContext.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.
element.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for charge item definition (if applicable)
element.definition: Berisi data wilayah hukum atau geografis di mana definisi item tagihan (jika berlaku) dengan tipe data CodeableConcept, yang nilainya dapat mengacu pada contoh data terminologi Jurisdication.
element.comment: It may be possible for the charge item definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: Berisi data pernyataan hak cipta yang berkaitan dengan definisi item tagihan dan/atau isinya dengan tipe data markdown.
element.requirements: Consumers must be able to determine any legal restrictions on the use of the charge item definition and/or its content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the charge item definition was approved by publisher
element.definition: Berisi data tanggal ketika definisi item tagihan disetujui dengan tipe data date.
element.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the charge item definition was last reviewed
element.definition: Berisi data tanggal terakhir kali definisi item tagihan ditinjau dengan tipe data date.
element.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.
element.requirements: Gives a sense of how "current" the content is.  Resources that have not been reviewed in a long time may have a risk of being less appropriate/relevant.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the charge item definition is expected to be used
element.definition: Berisi data periode efektif dari definisi item tagihan dapat digunakan dengan tipe data Period.
element.comment: The effective period for a charge item definition  determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.
element.requirements: Allows establishing a transition before a resource comes into effect and also allows for a sunsetting  process when new versions of the charge item definition are or are expected to be used instead.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Billing codes or product types this definition applies to
element.definition: Berisi kode penagihan atau jenis produk yang berlaku untuk definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Billing Code defined by this ChargeItemDefinition.

element.short: Instances this definition applies to
element.definition: Berisi data rincian tagihan yang berkaitan dengan produk yang diberikan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Medication | Substance | Device.
element.comment: In case of highly customized, individually produced or fitted devices/substances, the pricing information may be different for each instance of the product. This reference links pricing details to specific product instances.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Whether or not the billing code is applicable
element.definition: Expressions that describe applicability criteria for the billing code.
element.comment: The applicability conditions can be used to ascertain whether a billing item is allowed in a specific context. E.g. some billing codes may only be applicable in out-patient settings, only to male/female patients or only to children.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Natural language description of the condition
element.definition: Berisi data deskripsi singkat dalam bahasa alami dari kondisi yang efektif mengkomunikasikan semantik yang dimaksud dengan tipe data string.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Language of the expression
element.definition: Berisi tipe media bahasa untuk ekspresi, mis., 'teks/cql' untuk ekspresi Clinical Query Language atau 'teks/fhirpath' untuk ekspresi FHIRPath dengan tipe data string.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Boolean-valued expression
element.definition: Berisi data ekspresi yang mengembalikan nilai true atau false, menunjukkan apakah kondisi tersebut dipenuhi dengan tipe data string.
element.comment:
Please note that FHIRPath Expressions can only be evaluated in the scope of the current ChargeItem resource to which this definition is being applied.
FHIRPath expressions can traverse into other resources linked from the ChargeItem resource, however, testing rules such as that a billing code may be billed only once per encounter need a wider scope. In such scenarios, CQL may be the appropriate choice.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Group of properties which are applicable under the same conditions
element.definition: Group of properties which are applicable under the same conditions. If no applicability rules are established for the group, then all properties always apply.

element.short: Conditions under which the priceComponent is applicable
element.definition: Berisi ekspresi yang menggambarkan kriteria aplikabilitas untuk priceComponent.
element.comment: The applicability conditions can be used to ascertain whether a billing item is allowed in a specific context. E.g. some billing codes may only be applicable in out-patient settings, only to male/female patients or only to children.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Components of total line item price
element.definition: The price for a ChargeItem may be calculated as a base price with surcharges/deductions that apply in certain conditions. A ChargeItemDefinition resource that defines the prices, factors and conditions that apply to a billing code is currently under development. The priceComponent element can be used to offer transparency to the recipient of the Invoice of how the prices have been calculated.

element.short: base | surcharge | deduction | discount | tax | informational
element.definition: Berisi data untuk mengidentifikasi jenis komponen yang umumnya berupa base, surcharge, deduction, discount, tax, informational dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi InvoicePriceComponentType.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes indicating the kind of the price component.

element.short: Code identifying the specific component
element.definition: Berisi kode yang mengidentifikasi komponen dan dapat digunakan untuk membedakan jenis pajak, biaya tambahan, diskon, dll tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Factor used for calculating this component
element.definition: Berisi faktor yang telah diterapkan pada harga dasar penghitungan komponen tipe data decimal.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Monetary amount associated with this component
element.definition: Berisi nilai yang dihitung dalam komponen dengan tipe data Money.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi satu data URI absolut yang digunakan untuk mengidentifikasi definisi item tagihan, yang datanya direpresentasikan dengan tipe data uri.
Berisi data pengenal formal yang digunakan untuk mengidentifikasi definisi item tagihan yang direpresentasikan dengan tipe data Identifier.
Berisi data versi dari definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data string.
Berisi data judul singkat, deskriptif, yang ramah pengguna untuk definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data string.
Berisi data URL yang mendasari definisi item tagihan yang ditentukan secara eksternal dengan tipe data uri.
Berisi definisi yang lebih besar di mana definisi tertentu merupakan komponen atau langkah dengan tipe data canonical(ChargeItemDefinition).
Berisi data versi-versi baru dari protokol atau pedoman yang didefinisikan, memungkinkan identifikasi versi mana yang digantikan oleh instansi baru dengan tipe data canonical(ChargeItemDefinition).
Berisi data status dari definisi item tagihan yang umumnya akan berupa status draft, active, retired, dan unknown dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi PublicationStatus.

Berisi data untuk menunjukkan bahwa definisi item tagihan ditulis untuk tujuan pengujian (atau pendidikan/evaluasi/pemasaran) dan tidak dimaksudkan untuk digunakan secara nyata dengan tipe data boolean.
Berisi data tanggal (dan opsional waktu) ketika definisi item tagihan tersebut diterbitkan dengan tipe data dateTime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
Berisi data nama organisasi atau individu yang menerbitkan definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data string.
Berisi detail kontak untuk membantu pengguna menemukan dan berkomunikasi dengan penerbit dengan tipe data ContactDetail.
Berisi deskripsi teks bebas bahasa alami dari definisi item tagihan dari sudut pandang konsumen dengan tipe data markdown.
Berisi data konteks yang dikembangkan dengan fokus dan tujuan untuk mendukung konteks yang terdaftar dengan tipe data UsageContext.
Berisi data wilayah hukum atau geografis di mana definisi item tagihan (jika berlaku) dengan tipe data CodeableConcept, yang nilainya dapat mengacu pada contoh data terminologi Jurisdication.
Berisi data pernyataan hak cipta yang berkaitan dengan definisi item tagihan dan/atau isinya dengan tipe data markdown.
Berisi data tanggal ketika definisi item tagihan disetujui dengan tipe data date.
Berisi data tanggal terakhir kali definisi item tagihan ditinjau dengan tipe data date.
Berisi data periode efektif dari definisi item tagihan dapat digunakan dengan tipe data Period.
Berisi kode penagihan atau jenis produk yang berlaku untuk definisi item tagihan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data rincian tagihan yang berkaitan dengan produk yang diberikan dengan tipe data Reference yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Medication | Substance | Device.
Berisi data deskripsi singkat dalam bahasa alami dari kondisi yang efektif mengkomunikasikan semantik yang dimaksud dengan tipe data string.
Berisi tipe media bahasa untuk ekspresi, mis., 'teks/cql' untuk ekspresi Clinical Query Language atau 'teks/fhirpath' untuk ekspresi FHIRPath dengan tipe data string.
Berisi data ekspresi yang mengembalikan nilai true atau false, menunjukkan apakah kondisi tersebut dipenuhi dengan tipe data string.
Berisi ekspresi yang menggambarkan kriteria aplikabilitas untuk priceComponent.

Berisi data untuk mengidentifikasi jenis komponen yang umumnya berupa base, surcharge, deduction, discount, tax, informational dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi InvoicePriceComponentType.
Berisi kode yang mengidentifikasi komponen dan dapat digunakan untuk membedakan jenis pajak, biaya tambahan, diskon, dll tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi faktor yang telah diterapkan pada harga dasar penghitungan komponen tipe data decimal.
Berisi nilai yang dihitung dalam komponen dengan tipe data Money.
